240.question: What was the performance of both approaches on their dataset?
240.response: {'Answer': 'The performance of both i-vector and x-vector approaches on their datasets is shown in the tables in Image 0 and Image 1. The i-vector system achieved EERs of 5.30%, 7.30% and 19.05% on SITW, SITW(S) and CN-Celeb(E) respectively when trained on VoxCeleb. The x-vector system achieved EERs of 3.75%, 4.78% and 15.52% on the same datasets when trained on VoxCeleb.'}
240.answer: ERR of 19.05 with i-vectors and 15.52 with x-vectors

242.question: What genres are covered?
242.response: {'Answer': 'The genres covered are entertainment, interview, singing, play, movie, vlog, live broadcast, speech, drama, recitation and advertisement.'}
242.answer: genre, entertainment, interview, singing, play, movie, vlog, live broadcast, speech, drama, recitation and advertisement

244.question: Which of the two speech recognition models works better overall on CN-Celeb?
244.response: {'Answer': 'For i-vector model, the one with both front-end and back-end trained on CN-Celeb(T) works better (14.24<15.00, 14.24<15.50); For x-vector model, the one with both front-end and back-end trained on CN-Celeb(T) also works better (14.78<11.99, 14.78<15.62).'}

245.question: By how much is performance on CN-Celeb inferior to performance on VoxCeleb?
245.response: {'Answer': 'The provided images do not contain information on by how much performance on CN-Celeb is inferior to VoxCeleb.'}
245.answer: For i-vector system, performances are 11.75% inferior to voxceleb. For x-vector system, performances are 10.74% inferior to voxceleb
